body:
Ideal candidate:

- University degree
- HR Inspector diploma (compulsory)
- Minimum of 3 years experience in HR / Recruitment
- Strong knowledge of Labour legislation (e.g. labour contracts, disciplinary investigations, tax, social insurance) and relevant legislation in the field
- Flexible and able to work on more projects in the same time
- Proven ability to effectively communicate across all levels of the organisation
- Proactive, assertive, organized and trustful person
- Team orientation, collaborative working style 
- Strong English language skills (speaking and writing)
- Proficiency in MS Office, Salary program

Job description:

- Planning, organizing and supervising the human resources activity
- Manage all aspects of the recruiting process, including sourcing, screening, tests, interviewing, and selection 
- Keeping updated the HR documents, employee files and reports, databases and other related records
- Processing and analysing personnel reports and statistics
- Being responsible with payroll activities: calculating monthly salaries, vacations, sick leaves and other monthly benefits in accordance with the labour legislation
- Drawing up the payment statement and salary declarations
- Implementing the training plans, meeting the requests of the heads of departments for organizing internal and external skills upgrade courses
- Advising the managers concerning: their relationship with the employees, the legal issues of the negotiations with the employee’s representatives, etc
- Taking part in solving the work conflicts and the employees' complaints and keeping a close relationship with the employee’s representatives
- Drawing up together with the project manager the internal regulation and collective contract 
- Preparing periodical reports regarding human resources activity

We are looking for an honest and motivated new colleague to join our team.
title: Human Resources Responsible
locations: Strada prundu, Pitești, Județul Argeș, România
